meanings.definition: Of or relating to the nostrils.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined her naric passages to check for any blockages.
meanings.sent2: She felt a naric tickle as she inhaled the fragrant flowers.
meanings.sent3: The naric spray she used made her sneeze uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The naric scent of the bakery wafted through the air, enticing customers.
meanings.sent5: His naric sensitivity to pollen caused him to avoid parks during spring.

meanings.sent1: She could feel the cold air entering her naric as she breathed in deeply.
meanings.sent2: The sweet aroma of the flowers tickled her naric as she walked through the garden.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally got paint on his naric while working on the art project.
meanings.sent4: The naric of the statue seemed to be flaring in the moonlight, giving it an eerie look.
meanings.sent5: The spicy soup's steam cleared her naric, making her feel refreshed.
